Jx.Columns

Extends: Jx.Object

This class is the container for all columns needed for a grid.  It consolidates many functions that didn’t make sense to put directly in the column class.  Think of it as a model for columns.

License

This file is licensed under an MIT style license

Summary
Jx.ColumnsExtends: Jx.Object
Options
headerRowHeightthe default height of the header row.
useHeadersDetermines if the column headers should be displayed or not
columnsan array holding all of the column instances or objects containing configuration info for the column
Functions
initCreates the class.
addColumnsadd new columns to the columns object after construction.
getHeaderHeightreturns the height of the column header row
useHeadersreturns whether the grid is/should display headers or not
getByNameUsed to get a column object by the name of the column
getByFieldUsed to get a column by the model field it represents
getByGridIndexUsed to get a column when all you know is the cell index in the grid
getHeadersReturns a row with the headers in it.
calculateWidthsforce calculation of column widths.
getColumnCountreturns the number of columns in this model (including hidden).
getIndexFromGridGets the index of a column from its place in the grid.

Options

headerRowHeight

the default height of the header row.  Set to null or ‘auto’ to have this class attempt to figure out a suitable height.

useHeaders

Determines if the column headers should be displayed or not

columns

an array holding all of the column instances or objects containing configuration info for the column

Functions

init

init : function ()

Creates the class.

addColumns

addColumns: function(columns)

add new columns to the columns object after construction.  Causes the template to change.

Parameters

columns{Array} an array of columns to add

getHeaderHeight

getHeaderHeight : function (recalculate)

returns the height of the column header row

Parameters

recalculatedetermines if we should recalculate the height.  Currently does nothing.

useHeaders

useHeaders : function ()

returns whether the grid is/should display headers or not

getByName

getByName : function (colName)

Used to get a column object by the name of the column

Parameters

colNamethe name of the column

getByField

getByField : function (field)

Used to get a column by the model field it represents

Parameters

fieldthe field name to search by

getByGridIndex

getByGridIndex : function (index)

Used to get a column when all you know is the cell index in the grid

Parameters

indexan integer denoting the placement of the column in the grid (zero-based)

getHeaders

getHeaders : function (tr)

Returns a row with the headers in it.

Parameters

rowthe row to add the headers to.

calculateWidths

calculateWidths: function ()

force calculation of column widths.  For columns with ‘fit’ this will cause the column to test every value in the store to compute the optimal width of the column.  Columns marked as ‘expand’ will get any extra space left over between the column widths and the width of the grid container (if any).

getColumnCount

getColumnCount : function (noHidden)

returns the number of columns in this model (including hidden).

getIndexFromGrid

getIndexFromGrid : function (name)

Gets the index of a column from its place in the grid.

Parameters

namethe name of the column to get an index for
Base class for all other object in the JxLib framework.
